docs.snippet: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro insisted on Thursday his opponents would fail in a new push to oust him this year and end 17 years of socialist rule in the OPEC nation.
docs.lead_paragraph: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro insisted on Thursday his opponents would fail in a new push to oust him this year and end 17 years of socialist rule in the OPEC nation.

headline.main: 'You Won't Get Rid of Me!' Venezuela's Maduro Tells Foes
headline.print_headline: 'You Won't Get Rid of Me!' Venezuela's Maduro Tells Foes

docs.snippet: United Nations rights experts and more than 200 campaign groups called on the government of Honduras on Thursday to protect a key witness in the killing of activist Berta Caceres that has sparked widespread international condemnation.
docs.lead_paragraph: United Nations rights experts and more than 200 campaign groups called on the government of Honduras on Thursday to protect a key witness in the killing of activist Berta Caceres that has sparked widespread international condemnation.

headline.main: U.N. Experts, Advocates Urge Honduras to Protect Witness in Activist Murder
headline.print_headline: U.N. Experts, Advocates Urge Honduras to Protect Witness in Activist Murder

docs.snippet: The selection of Pratt & Whitney to build the engines for the new Northrop Grumman Corp B-21 bomber should help Pratt lower the cost of its F135 engines that power the Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 fighter jet, a top Air Force general said Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The selection of Pratt & Whitney to build the engines for the new Northrop Grumman Corp B-21 bomber should help Pratt lower the cost of its F135 engines that power the Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 fighter jet, a top Air Force general said Thursday.

headline.main: U.S. F-35 Chief Expects Savings After Pratt's B-21 Bomber Win
headline.print_headline: U.S. F-35 Chief Expects Savings After Pratt's B-21 Bomber Win

docs.snippet: Replacing potentially lethal Takata Corp air bags in a mass recall is more challenging and time-consuming than expected as rival parts suppliers struggle to make bag inflators that replicate the originals fitted by the Japanese firm.
docs.lead_paragraph: Replacing potentially lethal Takata Corp air bags in a mass recall is more challenging and time-consuming than expected as rival parts suppliers struggle to make bag inflators that replicate the originals fitted by the Japanese firm.

headline.main: 'Hamburgers',' Hotdogs' and How Air Bag Rivals Are Struggling to Displace Takata
headline.print_headline: 'Hamburgers',' Hotdogs' and How Air Bag Rivals Are Struggling to Displace Takata

docs.snippet: Former Russian Press Minister Mikhail Lesin, who was found dead in a Washington hotel room last year, died of blunt force injuries to the head, U.S. authorities said on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Russian Press Minister Mikhail Lesin, who was found dead in a Washington hotel room last year, died of blunt force injuries to the head, U.S. authorities said on Thursday.

headline.main: Former Russian Press Minister Died in U.S. of Blunt Force Injuries
headline.print_headline: Former Russian Press Minister Died in U.S. of Blunt Force Injuries

docs.snippet: President Obama includes an overdue domestic push to cut leaks in America’s vast natural gas system in a joint announcement with his Canadian counterpart.
docs.abstract: President Obama includes an overdue domestic push to cut leaks in America’s vast natural gas system in a joint announcement with his Canadian counterpart.

headline.main: The Obama-Trudeau Climate Pledge Contains Overdue Steps to Fix Natural Gas Leaks

docs.snippet: Trying to come back from a series of elbow injuries, Oakland pitcher Jarrod Parker hurt his elbow yet again on the 12th pitch of a simulated game Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Trying to come back from a series of elbow injuries, Oakland pitcher Jarrod Parker hurt his elbow yet again on the 12th pitch of a simulated game Thursday.

headline.main: A's Right-Hander Jarrod Parker Injures His Elbow Yet Again
headline.print_headline: A's Right-Hander Jarrod Parker Injures His Elbow Yet Again

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama said Thursday the Supreme Court needs to operate with its full contingent of nine justices as he signaled he will soon announce his nominee to replace the late Justice Antonin Scalia.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said Thursday the Supreme Court needs to operate with its full contingent of nine justices as he signaled he will soon announce his nominee to replace the late Justice Antonin Scalia.

headline.main: Republicans Dig In on Blocking Obama's Court Nominee
headline.print_headline: Republicans Dig In on Blocking Obama's Court Nominee

docs.snippet: Fifteen years after calling the open-source operating system Linux a "cancer," former Microsoft Corp Chief Executive Steve Ballmer has softened his position.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fifteen years after calling the open-source operating system Linux a "cancer," former Microsoft Corp Chief Executive Steve Ballmer has softened his position.

headline.main: Former Microsoft CEO Ballmer Does About-Face on Linux Technology
headline.print_headline: Former Microsoft CEO Ballmer Does About-Face on Linux Technology

docs.snippet: Pistachios sold under the brands of Wonderful, Paramount Farms and Trader Joe's have been recalled nationwide because they may be contaminated with salmonella.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pistachios sold under the brands of Wonderful, Paramount Farms and Trader Joe's have been recalled nationwide because they may be contaminated with salmonella.

headline.main: Salmonella Threat Leads to National Recall of Pistachios
headline.print_headline: Salmonella Threat Leads to National Recall of Pistachios
